form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: Screeneded by NARA: 06/29/2023, U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION & NATURALIZATION SERVICE WESTERN REGIONAL PROCESSING FACILITY

full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/29/2023 October 10, 1989 U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION & NATURALIZATION SERVICE WESTERN REGIONAL PROCESSING FACILITY P.O. BOX 30030 LAGUNA NIGUEL, CA 92677-0030 RE: File No. A92360662 Attn: Mr. JOSEPH L THOMAS Director Regional Processing Facility Dear Director: I am writing you this letter to humbly request your attention to my case and my problem, which is as follows: I have been granted my Temporary Resident Card through the Amnesty program. On June, 1989, I sent to your office my application to adjust my status as a Permanent Resident in this country, but unfortunately, I have not received any response from you. Please be advised that it has been four (4) months since I sent you the application, and have not heard anything yet. Be advised that I have complied with all the rules and regulations imposed by the Immigration and Naturalization Service in order to obtain my legal residence in this country. I have been living here for more than 10 years and I am really concerned and worried about my status. I humbly request that you do everything possible SO that my Permanent Resident Card may be granted. 1000 buy Thanking you kindly for your time and consideration to this matter. 5 Very truly yours, Maria Motus Hunter & is OCT burd OUR 1109 ONEONTA DR LOS ANGELES, CA 90065 (213) 258-4569
